p: In North Karelia, South-East Veluwe and Montafon, CPC ranged from +15.8% to +33.6% ( figure 2, table SOM2). The productivity increases in North Wales were smaller and turned negative for the drier site. In the Black Forest, CPC was negative and ranged between −10.6% and −24.4%, depending on the time period considered. In the two southern European forest case studies, CPC was mostly negative (−22.8% to −37.6% in Chamusca and −0.8% to −19.4% in Prades) with the exception of forests on deep soils in the Prades region, which showed a small productivity increase ( figure 2).
